messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant with high skills in software development. The user will ask you to implement/create an application module using Cross-Platform .NET 9 C# code that adheres to the following interface:

"public interface IGeneratedModule { public string Name { get; set; } public bool Main(string dataFolder); }"

### Requirements:
- The generated code must avoid using external APIs if possible, in case an API is needed add it to the list of required APIS.
_ If the generated code needs NuGets installed add the NuGet name to the list of required Nugets.
- The response must be in JSON format.
- The `source_code` field must contain C# code only (avoid markdown notation).
- Do not include the IGeneratedModule in the generated source code.
- The generated code **must not include any instructions that begin with `Console.WriteLine($`**.
- If data persistence is required, use JSON files stored in the `dataFolder` parameter of the `Main` method.
- Ensure the generated module is as detailed and complete as possible.
- The constructor of the generated module must not have any parameters.
- The generated code MUST not call Exit method. When the implemented Main method finish the excution control is passed to the main application.
- The generated code must print information in the console to let know the user the module is running.
- The generated code must implement CRUPDS operations for the data models.

### Example output:
{"source_code":"GENERATED C# CODE","description": "GENERATED DESCRIPTION FOR THE MODULE", "required_apis"=[{"API_1"},{"API_2"}], , "required_nugets"=[{ "nuget_name":"MISSING_NUGET_1","nuget_version":"1.0.0" },{ "nuget_name":"MISSING_NUGET_2","nuget_version":"2.0.0.0" }]}

Generate a Cross-Platform .NET 9 C# code that implements the next interface "public interface IGeneratedModule { public string Name { get; set; } public bool Main(string dataFolder); }" the Main method is the start point for the module. The souce code will run on a console application. The generated code must not write strings to console like this Console.WriteLine($"{variable}"). The source code will be automaticallty compiled so avoid adding markdown notation or anything that is not c# code The module must: Design a software module to help teachers manage student attendance across multiple groups. The module should allow the teacher to create and manage groups of students, record daily attendance, and generate weekly attendance summaries. The teacher should be able to view and update attendance records for each group on a daily basis. At the end of the week, the module should automatically calculate and display the attendance percentage for each group. The system should ensure data integrity and provide an intuitive interface for the teacher to interact with the attendance records.
## Funcional Details ##
Create and manage student groups
Record daily attendance for each group
Generate weekly attendance summaries
Calculate attendance percentages per group
Provide an intuitive interface for teachers
## Required features ## 
Create, read, update, delete, and search (CRUDS) operations for groups
Create, read, update, delete, and search (CRUDS) operations for students
Record daily attendance for students
View daily attendance records
Generate weekly attendance summaries
Calculate and display attendance percentages per group
## User interaction ## 
Teacher creates a new group and adds students to it
Teacher marks attendance for each student in a group on a daily basis
Teacher views the attendance record for a specific day
Teacher generates a weekly attendance summary for a group
Teacher views the attendance percentage for a group at the end of the week
## Suggested data models ##
Group: {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "created_at": "date",
  "updated_at": "date"
}
Student: {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "group_id": "string",
  "created_at": "date",
  "updated_at": "date"
}
Attendance: {
  "id": "string",
  "student_id": "string",
  "date": "date",
  "status": "enum(present, absent, late, excused)",
  "notes": "string",
  "created_at": "date",
  "updated_at": "date"
}
WeeklySummary: {
  "id": "string",
  "group_id": "string",
  "week_start_date": "date",
  "week_end_date": "date",
  "total_students": "integer",
  "total_present": "integer",
  "total_absent": "integer",
  "total_late": "integer",
  "total_excused": "integer",
  "attendance_percentage": "float",
  "created_at": "date",
  "updated_at": "date"
}
